channel.title: Xp counter timer
channel.description: How am I able to set a timer for my xp counter I want the xp to flow before the hitmarks

item.title: Xp counter timer
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:

Certainly you didn’t understand what he was saying, by adding a timer or a task you’re not making anyone wait

[quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=671132.msg4488081#msg4488081 date=1435598458]

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

There’s a quick tutorial on timers… Apply it to your dark bow.

Or use CycleEvents.
[/quote][/quote]

Your not fully understanding what i mean, the timer i don’t want it to make people wait a certain amount of time or use something… specifically only want it to shoot the arrows out correctly and not at the same time.

item.title: Xp counter timer
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:15, topic:552194”][quote author=tank nation link=topic=671110.msg4490297#msg4490297 date=1437345240]

How am I able to set a timer for my xp counter I want the xp to flow before the hitmarks

BUMP!!!

Yeah, so what are you stuck on? I’ve already told you what to do.

Simply what I need to put so it works correctly, i know where it goes… just don’t know how to set up the code for it… i don’t understand how it works

You’ve added a timer before, you know the one for the dark bow?
Yeah. Same concept as that. Just different code.

I never added a timer for dark bow, or i would have knew what i was doing…
[/quote]
I told you step by step how to add a timer, and even provided tutorials. https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,671132.0.html
If you still cannot figure out how to add one, you need to go read up on Java more.[/quote]cant he use tasks for that?

Read full topic

item.title: Xp counter timer
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:552194”][quote author=tank nation link=topic=671110.msg4487999#msg4487999 date=1435527470]

I literally just told you how to make a timer…

So i set this variable as shown, “Public int current system time + Timer” without quotations.
and then the other stuff you said.
[/quote]
No, you don’t set the variable name as that…
Nor do you capitalize public.
I said to declare a variable that gets set to the current system time plus the time you want it to be delayed.
I did not say to declare the variable “current system time” because that wouldn’t be valid.[/quote]rep

Read full topic

item.title: Xp counter timer
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:552194”]1) Send the Exp gained before sending the hitmarks (As I’ve told you more than once in the past)

  1. Edit the packet that sends the xp counter to set a variable to current system time + Timer. Then in the code that makes the xp display, make sure said variable is not greater than the current time.
    Note: doing this will cause all exp shown to be on a delay.

  2. cheaphack your packets.[/quote]

I know what you mean about setting the Exp before the hitmarks it just im having trouble with the timer… thats what i don’t get not sure what code i need to use!

Read full topic

item.title: Xp counter timer
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

  1. Send the Exp gained before sending the hitmarks (As I’ve told you more than once in the past)

  2. Edit the packet that sends the xp counter to set a variable to current system time + Timer. Then in the code that makes the xp display, make sure said variable is not greater than the current time.
    Note: doing this will cause all exp shown to be on a delay.

  3. cheaphack your packets.

Read full topic
